availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William T. Wilson (Green County, Kentucky, stonemason and soldier.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, stonemason and soldier. Nelson County, Kentucky, native. Son of Samuel M. Wilson and Mary Stearman Wilson. Married to Nancy C. Moore in Green County, Kentucky, on August 19, 1861. Father of Nannie William Wilson. Resident of Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Stonemason in Green County in 1860. Enlisted in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a sergeant on September 25, 1861. Died at Camp Hobson, Taylor County, Kentucky, on December 28, 1861.

ab.bibl:
